bug.author: KubaFYI
bug.summary: Velocity of BP_FlyingPawn acquired by "Get Physics Linear Velocity" is very noisy (while SuvCarPawn is fine)
bug.description:
I am implementing new ImageType which dynamically depends on the pawn velocity. Currently I use the <denchmark-link:http://api.unrealengine.com/INT/BlueprintAPI/Physics/GetPhysicsLinearVelocity/>Get Physics Linear Velocity</denchmark-link> function on the pawn's Body Mesh to extract that velocity and use it within Unreal as such: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5529099/42245103-7369e2b8-7f0f-11e8-842f-e4f3087c9fe1.PNG></denchmark-link>
Unfortunately the velocity I get ends up very noisy, as clearly visible in my new ImageType (the second sub-window below), and kinda visible in the way the velocity magnitude printed in the upper left corner jumps around. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5529099/42245373-7a31c8bc-7f10-11e8-8e8c-8da8f54a1003.gif></denchmark-link>
What I found curious is that when I apply the same procedure to a Car simulation, the result is just fine, as seen below. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5529099/42245401-9a6edca0-7f10-11e8-867d-7c57892df2a9.gif></denchmark-link>
Is this a known problem? Any ideas on how to fix this, or at least some alternative ways of reading the vehicle velocity into a post-process material?
